author: Special Correspondent
text:
The male leopard cub which was transported to the Vandalur zoo in Chennai on Saturday. —Photo: M. Sathyamoorthy

A two-year-old male sub-adult leopard which was found trapped in a snare near Gandhi Nagar in Lovedale reserve forest area in Nilgiris South division on Tuesday was taken to Aringar Anna Zoological Park in Vandalur near Chennai on Saturday night. The leopard is expected to reach on Sunday morning.

Forest Department officials led by Divisional Forest Officer C. Badrasamy, Wildlife Biologist from WWF Boominathan and activist Sadiq rescued the leopard even as the Mudumalai Forest Veterinarian darted and tranquilised the animal. It was later taken for treatment.

After nursing for the wounds it sustained because of the snare trap, officials loaded the leopard onto a cargo vehicle and was taken to Vandalur Zoo late on Saturday night.
title: Male leopard taken to Vandalur zoo
